title.narrative: Zambia Economic Resilience Program for Improved Food Security Program (MAWA)

description.narrative: (Zambia): The Zambia Economic Resilience Program for Improved Food Security or Mawa, will increase the resilience of vulnerable families through nutrition, health and agricultural interventions. FY 2015 funding will promote better nutrition and growth by helping families produce, preserve and consume diverse, nutritious, and quality foods. The activity will train caregivers on essential care and feeding practices to support nutrition for pregnant and breastfeeding women and children under the age of two. They will also build capacity among vulnerable farmers, improving agricultural production skills needed to transition from subsistence farming to producing for market. Mawa will focus on building financial, business and marketing skills to grow assets and access markets, group management skills to access services collectively, innovation skills to help farmers adapt to change and sustainable production skills to help protect and sustain soil and water, thus adapting to climate change. FY 2015 funding will benefit 26,189 households and support improved feeding practices for 15,204 children under-five.
